title.narrative: ACCESS SAFE DRINKING WATER/WASH PACKAGE

description.narrative: By 2022, targeted rural and suburban communities have sustainable and equitable access to safe drinking water and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) package., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,boys and girls aged 0-59 months, adolescents and women (especially those living in the most disadvantaged communities) have access to basic services, use packages of multisectoral high-impact, gender-sensitive interventions (health /HIV, nutrition, WASH) and adopt appropriate behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, targeted rural and suburban communities have sustainable and equitable access to safe drinking water and WASH package.

description.narrative: In 2019, 825,205 new people from 1,942 rural communities were living in an ODF environment in Guinea, where the Government has taken steps to develop and implement a road map to end open defecation by 2025. Moreover, 40,500 new people (including around 30,000 children) have access to safe water in rural communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of targeted population provided with hygiene kits or key hygiene items in the reporting year [COVID]

Number of villages with a clean environment (no open defecation)
Number of schools supported by UNICEF during the year of reporting with separate sanitation facilities for boys and girls
Availability of a costed plan in place to promote hygiene and handwashing in response to COVID-19 [COVID]
